To most of our students, today is just a history lesson.
To those of us who lost loved ones and remember watching those events unfold, we must remind our students of the day America came together as one!
The pride we felt seeing the America flag raised from the rubble.
9-11 Never Forgotten! 🇺🇸💕

post_text: 🐾 Important: Drop Off Information
shared_text:
Mini Panthers
September 10 at 6:31 PM ·

Thank you for your patience as we navigate morning drop-off for the first few days of school. In an effort to make it less congested in the parking lot, we are going to try to divide drop-off into two rows. We anticipate that this will move much quicker within the coming weeks.

***If your child is in 3-6, please pull down the middle row and a staff member will meet you at your car, take your child's temperature and guide them into the building.
***If your child is in UPK-2, please pull up in front of the school where a staff member will meet you at your car, take your child's temperature and guide them into the building.
***If you have children in multiple grades, please pull into the UPK-2 lane in front of the school.
***If you have UPK/K students, you are welcome to park in the parking lot and enter through the kindergarten side doors, or if you feel that your child is comfortable, you can pull up to the school and we will help them in.

Please remember that drop-off is from 8:45-9:00

Thank you! 😊

September 4 at 11:49 AM ·

"Your 5th grade team would like to welcome you. :) We are excited to meet you all and look forward to the new school year.

To help "lessen your load" on the first day, leave your school supplies at home. We will use them during the year, but we can't use the lockers and you will have to carry what you bring back home every day.

Please bring ONLY your backpack with 1 notebook, 1 folder and your pencil bag/box with pencils (if you have them already) It's ok if you don't. We can help.

If you have your device, accept your google classroom invitations so you are ready for the first day. WE PROMISE, we will NOT send work before then. :) See you next week! Enjoy your weekend!!"

Town of Hoosick Youth Baseball & Softball is feeling disappointed.
May 3 at 9:32 PM ·

Hello All,

I regret to inform you that our 2020 little league baseball and softball season is canceled. We as a board have decided that it is in the best interest for everyone involved to not have a season and to put safety above all other things. We would like to thank all of you for being patient during this time and allowing us to make the best decision possible. We would also like to thank everyone who signed their child or children up and to all the volunteers and sponsors who were willing to help out as well. Everyone will be given a full refund...please just be patient we will get them to you as quick as we can. We are sorry for the boys and girls who would have been graduates this year but your career is not over and we wish you all the best in the future. We hope to see everyone back next year and it will be great to see our young boys and girls playing ball again. Stay safe everyone and we look forward to seeing you all next year.

Thank You,

Josh Whalen

Hello All,

I regret to inform you that our 2020 little league baseball and softball season is canceled. We as a board have decided that it is in the best interest for everyone involved to not have a season and to put safety above all other things. We would like to thank all of you for being patient during this time and allowing us to make the best decision possible. We would also like to thank everyone who signed their child or children up and to all the volunteers and sponsors who were willing to help out as well. Everyone will be given a full refund...please just be patient we will get them to you as quick as we can. We are sorry for the boys and girls who would have been graduates this year but your career is not over and we wish you all the best in the future. We hope to see everyone back next year and it will be great to see our young boys and girls playing ball again. Stay safe everyone and we look forward to seeing you all next year.

Thank You,

Josh Whalen

Mr. Connolly

VNA & Hospice of the Southwest Region
November 5, 2019 at 7:26 PM ·

In the late 1940s, Florence "Midge" Jones had to leave Hoosick Falls Central School to help care for her family. Proudly admitting she will be 92 next month, the one thing Midge has said she would have loved was to get her high school diploma. With that, our hospice team quickly got to work. VNAHSR Hospice Chaplain, Melissa O'Brien reached out to the current principal, Michael Hall and with a little research into Midge's schooling at HFCSD he, the Board of Education for Hoosick Falls School and the Superintendent were proud to present her with her long-wished diploma. Friends, family, her husband Tom, Melissa O'Brien and many of her friends from VNAHSR, surrounded her at this joyous and tear-filled moment. Thank you for allowing us to be part of this occasion and Congratulations, Midge!
